statement.tex: \text{A and B throw a die alternatively till one}\\ \text{of them gets a number greater than 4 and}\\ \text{wins the game. If A starts the game, then}\\ \text{what is the probability of B winning?}
\\ \textbf{Winning in a round}\\ \text{If a single throw by A and a single throw}\\ \text{by B makes up one round of throwing,}\\ \text{then are the following probabilities correct?}
\\ \textbf{Winning the game.}\\ \text{The probability that B wins the game}\\ \text{is therefore the following.} \textbf{ Right or wrong? } \\

reason.tex: \text{To win, one must get an }N\gt 4.\\ \text{Which means, }N\in\lbrace 5,6 \rbrace. \\ \text{So, probability } = \dfrac{n(\lbrace 5,6\rbrace)}{n(\lbrace 1,2,3,4,5,6 \rbrace)} = \dfrac{1}{3}.
